casebody.data:
The CITY OF CHARLOTTE
v.
UNIVERSITY FINANCIAL PROPERTIES, LLC, et al. 183PA16-2 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 11, 2019 Benjamin R. Sullivan, Jr., Attorney at Law, Nicolas E. Tosco, Attorney at Law, Charles C. Meeker, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, DeWitt McCarley, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for The City of Charlotte. Martin L. White, Attorney at Law, R. Susanne Todd, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, David V. Brennan, Attorney at Law, for University Financial Properties, LLC. Jessica Odom Wilkie, Attorney at Law, Joshua D. Hansen, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for NC Advocates for Justice.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 8th of March 2019 by North Carolina Advocates for Justice for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 11th of March 2019."

Unless already submitted, the Amicus Brief shall be submitted to the court within the times allowed and in the manner provided by Appellate Rule 28(i).
